title: Google’s ‘Cloud’ Business Alone May Be Worth More Than Oracle, IBM, or Salesforce
text:
One of the least-appreciated elements of the cloud-computing phenomenon is the sheer size and scope of the three largest players in the market, all hidden inside much larger businesses.

The best understood and most analyzed is Amazon Web Services, a business which arguably accounts for more than half of parent Amazon.com’s (ticker: AMZN) valuation, and which as we have written before might be one of the 10 largest companies in the world on a stand-alone basis. Microsoft (MSFT) has made a huge commitment to Azure, the software...
description: Google Cloud is the #3 player in the market, and investors arguably aren’t giving it much weight in their valuation of Alphabet shares—but that might be a gigantic mistake.
